title: ASTRAL Score for Ischemic Stroke
desc: ASTRAL Score for Ischemic Stroke predicts 90-day poor outcome in patients with acute ischemic stroke.

orgreference.text: Ntaios G, Faouzi M, Ferrari J, Lang W, Vemmos K, Michel P. An integer-based score to predict functional outcome in acute ischemic stroke: the ASTRAL score. Neurology. 2012;78(24):1916-22.

data.evidence:
Addition of the selected points: 

Age

1 point for every 5 years

  --

Severity

1 point for every admission NIHSS point

  --

Time delay between symptom onset or last proof of good health and admission

2 points if >3 hours

0 points if ≤3 hours

Range of visual fields (new visual field defect)

2 points if yes

0 points if no

Glucose at admission

1 point if >7.3 or <3.7 mmol/L

0 points if 3.7-7.3 mmol

Level of consciousness

3 points if impaired

0 points if normal

inputs.label_en: >3 hrs from symptom onset (or last time seen WITHOUT stroke symptoms) to admission

inputs.label_en: any brand-new flaw in the visual field.
inputs.name: defect

inputs.label_en: Admission glucose >131 mg/dL (7.3 mmol/L) or <66 mg/dL (3.7 mmol/L)
